intro: Matelea hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy matelea, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related genera. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are typically opposite and ovate, with a rough texture. Matelea hirsuta is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments.
